Click [here](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/m/1/59207972/p1-b23107-cc5a23a4be0f404c99195a8392d54121/1/124/7923da4e-6591-41b1-9a7b-87d8ac136be3#) if you are having trouble viewing this message.
 ![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png) 

Welcome to April's Turing-Roche newsletter! We hope you had a lovely Easter break if that took place where you are. Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both The Alan Turing Institute, Roche and beyond.

Our [five year partnership](http://elink.turing.ac.) was set up officially in June 2021 following a successful [Data Study Group](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/yINkfAswaEp4ds7xnyeq5Q) and a 12 week research project on lung cancer treatment. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care. **

We will be covering multiple activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the wider community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at vhellon@turing.ac.uk

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](http://elink.turing.ac._).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif) 

### Knowledge Share Series Event: AI and Health Equity

**25 April 2023**

Join us for our [partnership knowledge share series](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/YYgUZJRwARA5nAyLSv4sBQ). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

April's event is on the 25th and this month our theme will be AI and Health Equity. We'll be exploring how we ensure emerging technologies improve healthcare for all and do not exacerbate existing inequalities in the system.

We will be hearing from Honghan Wu, Turing Fellow and an Associate Professor at the Institute of Health Informatics, University College London and Fanny Sie, Head of AI and Emerging Technology External Collaborations at Roche. You can register for the event [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/IOt9vP613FOk6qOrIamc1g).

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](http://elink.turing.ac._7DIwKEjA).

## Current Opportunities at The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

 ![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg) 

### Bioinformatics and Computational Biology: Health Data Research UK and Roche Summer School 2023

Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) and Roche are organising a Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Summer School which will involve talks by Roche and HDR UK scientists and group research activities. Following the school, participants will have an opportunity to apply for Roche internships. You can express your interest in [this form](http://elink.turing.ac._VLMy1r4-QjIag) and will be alerted when applications open.

### Turing Institute Job Opportunity: Research Project Manager

**Deadline for applications: 01 May 2023**

Our Turing-Roche partnership project manager Alvaro has sadly left us to take up an amazing new position as the manager of a microscopy institution in Madrid- we're grateful for all his work and wish him the best! We are now looking to recruit his replacement- a Research Project Manager role within the Turing's Health and Medical Sciences programme. The role will include administering a portfolio of high impact research projects, as well as overseeing, planning, organising and communicating the activities generated by those projects. You can find out more and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac.).

### Summer 2023 Data Engineering Intern Opportunity at Roche

Roche are looking for a Data Engineering intern for the summer to explore 100 prototype features that enrich an internal clinico-genomic database with >75,000 cancer patients, generated from a recent hackathon. The applicant must be currently enrolled as a student in Switzerland or the EU and be studying Computer Science with quantitative focus or a Data Science related degree. More information and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/9k3yxdWQW67ADhT3__HwYQ).

### News: Turing's Chief Scientist Mark Girolami awarded the Guy Medal in Silver by the Royal Statistical Society

Congratulations to the Turing Institute's Chief Scientist Mark Girolami who has been awarded the Guy Medal in Silver by the Royal Statistical Society (RSS) for his contributions to computational statistics and machine learning - in particular, his work on differential geometric approaches to stochastic simulation for statistical inference. You can find out more about Mark's award, and the other winners of the RSS 2023 Honours [here](http://elink.turing.ac.-3lvTKg).

**Current Turing Institute [job vacancies](http://elink.turing.ac._gHw)**

**Current Roche [job vacancies](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/zCqGAyseZNZPlMJ5xprhNw)**

## Events

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### ESRC Digital Footprints Workshop: Identifying Researcher Needs

**18 April 2023**

The Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) are inviting researchers to an online workshop to explore researcher needs in relation to infrastructure for the ESRC Digital Footprints programme. This programme is an estimated £59.3 million investment in new research infrastructure for social sciences that will run between 2022 and 2029. They welcome colleagues from all social science disciplines who utilise, plan to use, or have insights into digital footprint data. Such data may range from consumer transactions to social media posts, from GIS mobility data to health data - any data traces we leave in our everyday interactions. Further information and registration [here](http://elink.turing.ac.).

### BSCC Life Sciences Programme: Should you trust digital healthcare?

**19 April 2023**

The British Swiss Chamber of Commerce (BSCC) are bringing together experts in a Oxford-style debate to share their research, insights and cautions when it comes to digital healthcare and centre the debate around the issues of data and trust. Among the four experts is Professor Katrina Bramstedt, Global Head of Bioethics at Roche. The event will be held in Basel, Switzerland and you can register [here](http://elink.turing.ac._-HNJqgRJGF1Ok2STnQ).

### AIM-RSF Seminar: AI for multiple long-term conditions Research Support Facility (AIM RSF) Seminar: Public engagement- Data for science and health

**09 May 2023**

Organised by [AIM RSF](http://elink.turing.ac._6MptQxqETlGPcHAeybw), this seminar will feature Emily Jesper-Mir, Strategy and Engagement Manager for Understanding Patient Data at the Wellcome Trust. She will be sharing three examples of different approaches to engaging with patients and the public:

-   Closing gaps in patient data for Black and South Asian communities: a nationally representative survey, community research and engagement
-   A public guide to large datasets: cocreated with experts and members of the public
-   An easy-read guide to NHS data: cocreated with adults with learning disabilities

You can register for the event [here](http://elink.turing.ac.-nZTv31g).

### Statisticians in the Pharmaceutical Industry (PSI) 2023 Conference

**11-14 June 2023**

The PSI 2023 Conference will be held over 4 days in London, UK. As with previous PSI annual conferences, there will be talks on a wide range of statistical topics such as master protocols, HTA, and estimands as well as opportunities to support professional development via non-technical topics. The scientific program promises to be of interest to anyone interested in applying statistics and data science in drug development and healthcare whether they are from industry, academia or regulatory/HTA agencies.

On the Wednesday of the conference our partnership team members Chris Harbron and Robin Mitra will be giving talks in the 'High Dimensional Data' stream! Find the programme so far and how to register [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/1jFgms6s78qKoaLbaf3e6A).

### Royal Statistical Society: RSS International Conference 2023

**Registration Deadline: 05 June 2023**

**Conference: 04-07 September 2023**

The RSS International Conference regularly attracts more than 500 attendees from over 30 countries providing one of the best opportunities for anyone interested in statistics and data science to come together to share knowledge and network. The conference is being held in Harrogate, Yorkshire. As usual, the conference programme will feature top keynote speakers, invited topic sessions, professional development workshops, contributed and rapid-fire talks, and poster presentations, as well as many opportunities for networking.

The line-up of keynote speakers for the conference will include Anuj Srivastava (Florida State University), Mihaela van der Schaar (University of Cambridge), plus a discussion meeting on probabilistic and statistical aspects of machine learning. Conference information and registration [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/2E40OrZMd1LZhQ4x3r8utg).

## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg) 

### Job: Senior AI Research Engineer Positions at the University of Sheffield 

**Deadline: 24 April 2023**

The University of Sheffield's Department of Computer Science are creating a new AI Research Engineering team by recruiting two Senior AI Research Engineers and three AI Research Engineers. This team is part of the University's multi-million-pound investment to establish the new Centre for Machine Intelligence. This team will be led by Haiping Lu, Professor of Machine Learning. They are particularly welcoming applications from female candidates. More information about the roles and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac.).

### Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) Big Data for Complex Disease Driver (BDCD) Programme call for PhD project proposals

**Deadline: 28 April 2023**

HDR UK's BDCD Programme is calling for potential host organisations to put forward project proposals for up to five PhD studentships. This is an exciting opportunity to apply the potential of large-scale data to addressing some of the most pressing challenges in contemporary healthcare. Three years of funding will be available from HDR UK, with option for an additional year funded by the host research organisations. PhD project proposals must be aligned with the aims and objectives of BDCD Driver Programme. More information [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/trp4n8Z92Ru-Cz1BPoROGQ).

### Wellcome Trust Data Science Ideathon

**Application Deadline: 30 April 2023**

**Event: 10-12 July 2023**

The Wellcome Data Science Ideathon is a competition that will have teams compete to propose data science solutions to tackle three urgent health challenges: mental health, infectious diseases, and climate and health. 

The Ideathon is open to student teams and researcher teams. All team members must be affiliated with a Higher Education Institution or research institute in the UK. Around 25 teams will be selected as semi-finalists to compete in the event at Wellcome's offices in central London on 10-12 July 2023 and 10 of those teams will be selected as finalists and will be eligible to win prizes or grants. More info and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac._).

### 2023 Health Equity DataJam

**Deadline to submit: 30 April 2023**

Hosted by AcademyHealth, the 2023 Health Equity DataJam invites participants to transform raw data from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services into actionable insights and digital tools to bridge disparities of health, including those exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, Long COVID, and infection-associated chronic illnesses to ensure equitable access and wellness for all. Participants choose from one of six challenge tracks to be the focus of their proposed solution. Each track includes a curated list of datasets and resources as well as potential ideas for exploration. More information and how to submit [here](http://elink.turing.ac.-J304g).

### 2023 Florence Nightingale Award for Excellence in Healthcare Data Analytics

**Deadline: 01 May 2023**

The Royal Statistical Society and the Health Foundation are accepting entries for the 2023 Florence Nightingale Award for Excellence in Healthcare Data Analytics. Named after the Society's first female fellow, the award, now in its fourth year, recognises practitioners whose work in data analytics has led to significant improvements in patient care. Criteria for the award and how to submit [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/vmfWWNIzqq007KghDEGoLg).

### Job: Research Associate in Health Equity at Queen Mary, University of London

**Deadline: 02 May 2023**

The Centre for Primary Care within the Wolfson Institute of Population Health at Queen Mary University of London is inviting applications for a Research Associate in Health Equity to support the delivery of a programme of research exploring equity-focused quality improvement in health care. The post provides an excellent opportunity to develop knowledge, skills and expertise on health equity within health care settings and will provide opportunities to contribute to complementary research. More info and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/y5tHRyzTwvPOotE7UZn5vw).

### Royal Statistical Society Virtual Classroom: Introduction to R & Statistical Modelling in R

**09 May-12 May 2023**

The Royal Statistical Society are running a course to introduce participants to the R environment for statistical computing. The course focuses on entering, working with and visualising data in R, and linear regression modelling in R. It requires familiarity with basic statistical methods (e.g. t-tests, box plots) but assumes no previous knowledge of statistical computing. Register [here](http://elink.turing.ac._94biA).

### Job: Associate Professor in Statistical Methods and Machine Learning at the University of Oslo

**Deadline: 12 May 2023**

The University of Oslo are hiring a permanent Associate Professor in the Section for Statistics and Data Science at the Department of Mathematics. The section is very active and will host and lead INTEGREAT, The Norwegian Centre for Knowledge-driven Machine Learning, a prestigious centre of excellence funded by the Research Council of Norway with a generous grant of 16 mil Euro, together with matching funds from the academic partners University of Oslo and the University of Tromsø. The centre will operate from September 2023 to 2033 and will fund more than 60 PhD and postdoc positions.

The applicant must have a PhD in statistics, mathematics or computer science (or closely related fields) and further post-graduate research experience in statistical methodology and/or statistical machine learning theory and methods and their applications. More info and how to apply [here](http://elink.turing.ac._X2NsZGVlPVB2UHBGUXMzZl95djN1QlRhN1FTYjBSQ1NqRDFlRHQ2eWVYTHZYU29td1hyMWFqMG1ONzJWVmdjeEJIVXExUGEmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0wNmUyZDJhY2QwZjQ0NDgyYmQ1MWQ3OWFiNDkxNDY0MyZlc2lkPTE1MmI2MDU0LTg4ZDgtZWQxMS1hN2M2LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9/NqbNnvEEKa4r-e9Ysw3njA).

## Publication of the Month

 ![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg) 

### Causal machine learning for healthcare and precision medicine**

April's publication of the month is this [paper](http://elink.turing.ac.) from researchers at the University of Edinburgh and Canon Medical Research Europe, published in the Royal Society Open Science Journal. Very relevant to the partnership's aims, the paper explores how causal inference can be incorporated into different aspects of clinical decision support systems by using recent advances in machine learning and also discusses important challenges present in healthcare applications such as processing high-dimensional and unstructured data.
